author: wsjcom
title: Navy Faces Global Chinese Maritime Threat
text:
In “America Can’t Afford to Cede the Seas” (op-ed, May 15), Seth Cropsey is right: China is building a large naval-combat fleet to challenge U.S. maritime pre-eminence.
Troubling as that is, that’s not all China has been building. While Western attention has been focused on China’s highly visible island-building in the South China Sea, Chinese state-owned shipping and construction companies have assembled a global network of commercial ports that can be readily converted to military bases at which Chinese naval vessels could...
